content.body: Remind me. The built-in-modules proposal was never a fix for the name conflicts right? Forcing someone to ```import "@std/Object"; which would patch the Object using side-effects. Was it decided years ago to continue using global changes forever?
I think it would be nicer if instead we started having the prototypes of new builtins that get added to the language be frozen by default
then we can guarantee no issues of that sort in those new builtins
sirisian: I don't believe anyone ever proposed having built-in module imports be side-effecting, no
content.formatted_body: sirisian: I don't believe anyone ever proposed having built-in module imports be side-effecting, no

content.body: and the built-in modules proposal was never formally rejected IIRC but has certainly stalled, and we're not blocking stuff on it
voidhedron: that would prevent polyfills of later features, so we're not going to do that
content.formatted_body: voidhedron: that would prevent polyfills of later features, so we're not going to do that

content.body: maybe if there was a more official streamlined way of creating and applying polyfills
and *just* polyfills, no other random stuff
content.formatted_body: and just polyfills, no other random stuff

content.body: most people have gotten the memo about not adding random stuff now
so anyone doing it anyway would presumably be willing to use whatever "official" mechanism there was
